subject: Art & Design
title: Futura: The Bauhaus Type That Went to the Moon
description: A 60-second lesson on Futura: The Bauhaus Type That Went to the Moon.

hook.text: The plaque left on the moon by Apollo 11 astronauts is set in Futura. It's literally on another world.

buildup.text: Paul Renner designed Futura in 1927 based on Bauhaus principles: geometric shapes, no ornament.

discovery.text: Its 'O' is a near-perfect circle. Its 'A' is a clean triangle. Every letter is built from basic geometry.

twist.text: The Nazis banned Renner from teaching and briefly imprisoned him. Futura survived the regime that hated it.

climax.text: Supreme, Nike, and countless brands use Futura. Nearly 100 years later, it still looks modern.

punchline.text: A font named Futura still lives up to its name.

quiz.question: What design philosophy inspired Futura?
